Package info.ryandorman.simplescheduler.common

Class DBConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.ryandorman.simplescheduler.common.DBConnection
  • public class DBConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows straight forward access to a Database connection. The connection properties are read from connection.properties. Allows only one open DB connection to be obtained throughout the application. Auto-commit is turned off by default on connections. Close the connection before the application exits.

    • Method Detail

      • initDataSource

        private static void initDataSource()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the database properties from connection.properties and sets up the datasource.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there are issues reading the properties file

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                java.io.IOException
        Provides a database connection. The connection should not be obtained in a try-with-resources to avoid closing the connection due to its extension of java.lang.AutoClosable.
        Returns:
        Connection Reference to the application's current database connection
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If there is an issue establishing the connection
        java.io.IOException - If there are issues initializing the data source from the properties file

      • commit

        public static void commit()
        Commits any open transactions to the database.

      • close

        public static void close()
        Closes the existing connection to the database.

      • close

        public static void close​(java.sql.PreparedStatement stmt)
        Closes an existing java.sql.Statement.PreparedStatement associated with a connection.
        Parameters:
        stmt - java.sql.Statement.PreparedStatement to be closed
